pages.text: I'm not quite sure what happened... but all I know is that I'm here now; the open world in front of me. Sights, sounds, smells... it's almost overwhelming. But I need to gather myself.$(br2)I have a few things in my hands: a scroll of paper tied with a green ribbon, and some bread. The scroll... I'm not quite sure what it does, but I sense it's no ordinary

piece of paper. I better hang onto this; it may be useful later. The bread... good for a snack if I'm hungry later.$(br2)$(italics)$(#a84b0f)The Scroll of New Life can be used to set your spawnpoint, in lieu of a bed. It is a one-time use item, so be wise with where you choose to anchor yourself.$(br2)It can be overridden later on with other spawn setters like a bed.$()

Something tells me that nightfall won't be very pleasant; I can't quite place my finger on it, though.$(br2)I should take note of my surroundings and begin to gather materials, to anticipate whatever may come when the sun sets. A shelter and some basic tools are in line.$(br2)I feel as though I have some time to prepare, though that shouldn't make me complacent.

$(italics)$(#a84b0f)The day/night cycle in RotN is 40 minutes in real-time; 20 minutes of night and day, twice as long as vanilla Minecraft.$()$(br2)It's time to get a move on. I don't have any means of transportation other than my own body: running, swimming and jumping will be necessary to navigate through this vast world.$(br2)$(italics)$(#a84b0f)You can sprint by double tapping W or doing Ctrl + W.$()

$(italics)$(#a84b0f)Swim by pressing the same buttons as sprinting while underwater - this swimming is the same as in newer versions of Minecraft!$(br2)Go prone by pressing Z; press it again to stand up.$(br2)Sneak/crouch by pressing the left shift key; this will prevent you from falling off the edge of blocks.$(br2)Go into third person perspective with F5 and F6.$()

$(italics)$(#a84b0f)Dash by pressing ALT and the direction you want to go in. Dashing will be more or less effective depending on what armor you're wearing, and very slightly deplete your hunger. Dodge cooldown is indicated by the XP bar above your hotbar.$(br2)Do reacharound placement by crouching near a block's edge, and looking at the space under that block. Brackets [] will appear around your crosshair.$()
